## Background

Researchers use summary statistics produced by Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) for a broad range of downstream analyses. In recent years, available software for handling and using GWAS summary statistics has proliferated considerably, making it increasingly difficult to keep track of this software and to make decisions about which software to use. Panagiota Kontou and Pantelis Bagos recently conducted a systematic review of GWAS summary statistic software published or in pre-print as of December 2023 ([see here](https://doi.org/10.1186/s13040-024-00385-x)). Here I provide an overview of the software found in this systematic review, with brief descriptions of each software taken from the supplementary materials.

::: callout-tip
## The systematic review did not include software for calculating polygenic scores (e.g. LDpred2, PRS-CS) and so I might add this in the future.
:::

::: callout-note
## If there are any errors or important omissions, let me know.
:::
